p: Streptococci are nonmotile, Gram-positive, and catalase-negative coccoid bacteria that occur singly, in pairs, or as short chains when observed on stained smears. Streptococcus species commonly associated with disease in avian species include S. pyogenes, S. zooepidemicus ( S. gallinarum), S. bovis, S. dysgalactiae, S. gallinaceus, and S. mutans. Streptococci have been associated with acute septicemia, acute mortality with lameness, inappetence, diarrhea, joint infections, cellulitis, osteomyelitis, and endocarditis [ 22, 25].
